question.title: Customizing the look and feel for JButton to support linux platform

node.contents: Well seems you have a `NullPointerException`. Please could you post an [SSCCE](http://sscce.org) for better help sooner. How are you getting the Windows L&F? Because as far as I have read: *Windows L&fs are supported on Windows platforms only. This is valid for the Sun Windows L&f, as well as for the JGoodies Windows L&f, and the winlaf L&f.*

astNode.text: Well seems you have a `NullPointerException`. Please could you post an [SSCCE](http://sscce.org) for better help sooner. How are you getting the Windows L&F? Because as far as I have read: *Windows L&fs are supported on Windows platforms only. This is valid for the Sun Windows L&f, as well as for the JGoodies Windows L&f, and the winlaf L&f.*

node.contents: @AndrewThompson oh our good old friend MS...hence my comment *Windows L&fs are supported on Windows platforms only*

astNode.text: @AndrewThompson oh our good old friend MS...hence my comment *Windows L&fs are supported on Windows platforms only*

node.contents: *"requirement GUI should look as similar to windows look"* That is an ***idiotic*** requirement that (if you managed to implement it) would infuriate the typical OS X or Unix/Linux user. My suggestion is: ***Change** the requirement.*

astNode.text: *"requirement GUI should look as similar to windows look"* That is an ***idiotic*** requirement that (if you managed to implement it) would infuriate the typical OS X or Unix/Linux user. My suggestion is: ***Change** the requirement.*

node.contents: @DavidKroukamp Yes I noted that, though I thought you meant for some arcane technical reason, rather than (huck, ptui..) bloody law suits.

astNode.text: @DavidKroukamp Yes I noted that, though I thought you meant for some arcane technical reason, rather than (huck, ptui..) bloody law suits.

node.contents: And maybe attract unwanted legal attention.

astNode.text: And maybe attract unwanted legal attention.

node.contents: @CatalinaIsland Good point. I'd forgotten all those nasty little "can't look like us" lawsuits.

astNode.text: @CatalinaIsland Good point. I'd forgotten all those nasty little "can't look like us" lawsuits.

node.contents: Thanks alot. I fixed this issue by setting the button minimumsize.

astNode.text: Thanks alot. I fixed this issue by setting the button minimumsize.

node.contents: I am facing the look and feel problem(throwing exception as i mentioned in below) in Linux platform when i go with windows look and feel. but as per our requirement GUI should look as similar to windows look. so I thought of going with customizing the own look and feel. could you please help me out?

astNode.text: I am facing the look and feel problem(throwing exception as i mentioned in below) in Linux platform when i go with windows look and feel. but as per our requirement GUI should look as similar to windows look. so I thought of going with customizing the own look and feel. could you please help me out?
